thread.title: Playoff-bound Toronto Blue Jays see spike in attendance
thread.title_full: Playoff-bound Toronto Blue Jays see spike in attendance - The Globe and Mail

author: The Globe and Mail
title: Playoff-bound Toronto Blue Jays see spike in attendance
text:
A A The Toronto Blue Jays’ stellar season is translating into box-office success. The franchise saw its regular season attendance climb 17.65 per cent from last year to a total of nearly 2.8 million, according to figures from ESPN.com. The Jays have seen attendance levels surge in recent weeks as the team went on a hot streak that resulted Wednesday in clinching the American League East division title. The Blue Jays will compete in the postseason for the first time since 1993.
With a handful of games remaining in the Major League Baseball regular season, the Jays rank 8th out of 30 teams in average home attendance, with 34,504 fans per game. (The Jays’ remaining games are all on the road.) As recently as 2010, the Jays averaged a paltry 20,068 fans per home game, placing them 26th in the league.
